question: In context with the recent draft of the Electricity (Amendment) Bill, what does ECEA stand for?
explanation:
The Union power ministry has proposed the draft of the Electricity (Amendment) Bill, which seeks to set up an Electricity Contract Enforcement Authority (ECEA) with power of a civil court. It is proposed to settle disputes related to power purchase agreement between power generation companies (Gencos) and Distribution companies (Discoms).
This is the fourth draft bill being proposed since 2014. A National Renewable Energy Policy has also been proposed in the draft bill, to promote power generation from renewable sources.
